-- from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_%28category_theory%29, which is in turn taken from:
-- Mitchell, Barry (1965), Theory of categories, MR 0202787, p.12, Proposition 10.1
@[ext]
theorem image.ext [HasImage f] {W : C} {g h : Â«expr âŸ¶ Â» (image f) W} [HasLimit (parallelPair g h)]

  by
  let q := equalizer.Î¹ g h
  let e' := equalizer.lift _ w
  let F' : mono_factorisation f :=
    { I := equalizer g h
      m := Â«expr â‰« Â» q (image.Î¹ f)
      m_mono := by apply mono_comp
      e := e' }
  let v := image.lift F'
  have tâ‚€ : Â«expr â‰« Â» v (Â«expr â‰« Â» q (image.Î¹ f)) = image.Î¹ f := image.lift_fac F'
  have t : Â«expr â‰« Â» v q = (Â«exprğŸ™Â») (image f) :=
    (cancel_mono_id (image.Î¹ f)).1
      (by
        convert tâ‚€ using 1
        rw [category.assoc])
  -- The proof from wikipedia next proves `q â‰« v = ğŸ™ _`,
  -- and concludes that `equalizer g h â‰… image f`,
  -- but this isn't necessary.
  calc
    g = Â«expr â‰« Â» ((Â«exprğŸ™Â») (image f)) g := by rw [category.id_comp]
    _ = Â«expr â‰« Â» v (Â«expr â‰« Â» q g) := by rw [â† t, category.assoc]
    _ = Â«expr â‰« Â» v (Â«expr â‰« Â» q h) := by rw [equalizer.condition g h]
    _ = Â«expr â‰« Â» ((Â«exprğŸ™Â») (image f)) h := by rw [â† category.assoc, t]
    _ = h := by rw [category.id_comp]
    
#align image.ext image.ext
